repnme.cdata!: Guinea - Second Economic Management Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Economic
            Management Support Project for Guinea was satisfactory. The
            project achieved some of its objectives, institutional
            development was partially achieved, sustainability is
            uncertain, and the performance of the Bank was satisfactory
            while the Borrower's was less than satisfactory.
            Several lessons can be learned from this project. First,
            project design should be focused on a few key economic
            management functions, supported by a few co-financing
            partners, in order to minimize the additional burden on
            local management capacities. Second, project sustainability
            could be improved through a closer monitoring of the
            transfer of skills and closer supervision of in-service
            training. Finally, implementation could be improved through
            more rigorous supervision of progress reports, prepared by
            both the experts and local teams, and the definition of
            performance targets to monitor progress.

repnme.cdata!: Guinea - Second Economic Management Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The purpose of this project is to
            support long term institution building through planning and
            investment programming, management of public finance and of
            the civil service.  The project also seeks to improve the
            management and monitoring of the Government's Economic
            and Financial Recovery Program, particularly to facilitate
            the implementation of economic and institutional reforms
            within its structural adjustment program.  Furthermore, the
            project aims to develop sound economic legislation and
            strengthen the Government's civil service training
            capacity as well as to develop professional skills of a
            number of national cadres.  This project will achieve the
            above through technical assistance operations, training
            programs and fellowships as well as equipment and vehicle financing.
